definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
meandering and circuitous (idiom); complicated developments that never get anywhere/going around in circles

sentences.english: The plots are complicated, and they are flexuous and dramatic.
sentences.chinese: 情节是复杂的，他们是曲折和戏剧。

sentences.english: The mountain ridges in this area twist and twine, stretching endlessly.
sentences.chinese: 这个山区的山脉蜿蜒曲折，连绵不绝。

sentences.english: The world multi-polarization trend continues to develop in a zigzagging process.
sentences.chinese: 世界多极化趋势在曲折中发展。

sentences.english: This newly-built road twisted and turned across the hills.
sentences.chinese: 这条新建成的公路蜿蜓曲折地穿过群山。

sentences.english: On the contrary, things are always moving forward in its twisty way.
sentences.chinese: 反过来，事物的发展总是曲折着前进的。

sentences.english: The stone stairs stretches to the entrance of Liang Garden.
sentences.chinese: 蜿蜒曲折的石梯一直延伸至良庄入口处。

sentences.english: The winding trail caused us to lose our orientation.
sentences.chinese: 迂回曲折的小道使我们迷失了方向。

sentences.english: The paths of bluestone slates zigzag through the woods.
sentences.chinese: 自然曲折的青石板小路环绕林间。

sentences.english: Just thing the track of the development always all is in the turns and twists to go forward.
sentences.chinese: 只是事物发展的轨迹从来都是在曲折中前进。

sentences.english: With its twists and turns, Lombard Street is known as the most crooked in the world.
sentences.chinese: 曲折拐弯的隆巴德街恐怕是世界上最弯曲的街道了。

sentences.english: Longitudinalcheng he solid throughout, folding fighting snake river, tortuous.
sentences.chinese: 固城河纵贯全境，河道斗折蛇行，迂回曲折。

sentences.english: The coastal lines of Aegean Sea are long and winding where scatters with many gulf and dotted with numerous and island.
sentences.chinese: 爱琴海的海岸线非常曲折，港湾众多，岛屿星罗棋布。

sentences.english: The comb-shape road The zigzag road looks like a comb from afar.
sentences.chinese: 《木梳路段》蜿蜒曲折的山路形状像梳子一样。

sentences.english: And their mutual injury is the meandrous and intense reflection of their attachment consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 女性间的自相残害是依附意识的曲折和激烈的反映。

sentences.english: Thee car wound through the village.
sentences.chinese: 汽车曲曲折折地穿过村子。

sentences.english: Yan notes that the Möbius forms displayed both right and left handed twists.
sentences.chinese: 严指出，莫比乌斯形式显示正确和左手曲折。

definition: meandering and circuitous (idiom); complicated developments that never get anywhere/going around in circles
bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
potholed and bumpy road (idiom); fig. full of disappointment and dashed hopes
one climax follows another (of thrilling story)
lit. the willow trees make the shade, the flowers give the light (idiom); at one's darkest hour, a glimmer of hope/light at the end of the tunnel
shift in the trend of events/turnaround/plot shift in a book/turn in the conversation
the mountain road twists around each new peak (idiom)/(of a mountain road) twisting and turning/fig. an opportunity has come unexpectedly/things have taken a new turn
